title: Ticket #2992: Have Condor manage OOM
description:
When a job runs inside a cgroup, it basically has its own personal virtual memory subsystem. Part of this includes its own OOM-killer. As a part of cgroups, we can actually have the OOM-killer for inside the container be subservient to the procd.

I propose two changes:

  • If using the memory controller, the procd should manage the OOM-killer for the job. In the event the kernel detects the OOM-killer needs to run, the procd should hard kill the entire job.
  • If the procd is managing the OOM-killer, it should disable itself from being considered from OOM itself. This prevents some potentially nasty issues where it is unable to manage the jobs.
